issue.title: DeprecationWarning if sync test requests async fixture

labels.name: bot:chronographer:provided
labels.description: (automation) changelog entry is part of PR

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Fixes #10839, or at least the parts that pytest can handle. It also fixes https://github.com/agronholm/anyio/issues/789
pytest-trio already failed sync tests that were marked with `pytest.mark.trio`, this will now make that check redundant and we instead mark the test as erroring.

I'm not sure if we care to have a deprecation period for sync-test + autouse-async-fixture, while users may currently have test suites that pass they're very close to shooting themselves in the foot and they will be riddled with `RuntimeWarning: coroutine [...] was never awaited`

I briefly tested the fix against pytest-asyncio, pytest-trio and anyio's pytest plugin in case any of them would cause false alarms with actual async tests, but as far as I can tell there were no problems. But maybe @agronholm or @seifertm would like to confirm.

If a sync test depends on a sync fixture which itself depends on an async fixture the error message is perhaps slightly confusing. It might be enough to simply name the async fixture in the error message though.

TODO:
* [x] write changelog entry

- [ ] Include documentation when adding new features.

- [X] Allow maintainers to push and squash when merging my commits. Please uncheck this if you prefer to squash the commits yourself.

If this change fixes an issue, please:

- [ ] Add text like ``closes #XYZW`` to the PR description and/or commits (where ``XYZW`` is the issue number). See the [github docs](https://help.github.com/en/github/managing-your-work-on-github/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue#linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue-using-a-keyword) for more information.

Unless your change is trivial or a small documentation fix (e.g., a typo or reword of a small section) please:

- [ ] Create a new changelog file in the `changelog` folder, with a name like `<ISSUE NUMBER>.<TYPE>.rst`. See [changelog/README.rst](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/main/changelog/README.rst) for details.

  Write sentences in the **past or present tense**, examples:

  * *Improved verbose diff output with sequences.*
  * *Terminal summary statistics now use multiple colors.*

  Also make sure to end the sentence with a `.`.

- [ ] Add yourself to `AUTHORS` in alphabetical order.
-->

body: I want to take it up!

Hi @RonnyPfannschmidt 

I've made the requested changes to "Remove _pytest.compat.is_generator() and just use inspect.isgeneratorfunction() directly."

Regarding the additional note: "While we're there, I'd like to turn the xfail on 'yield tests'—a noop since Pytest 4!—into a hard error, to reduce the risk that users incorrectly believe that they're testing something":

Would you like me to just turn the xfail into a hard error, or should I also refactor hooks that use yield (e.g., @pytest.hookimpl(wrapper=True))? If so, are there any specific files you'd like me to focus on?

Thank you!

- just the xfail, which is guarded by the condition in your diff in `src/_pytest/python.py`.  yield fixtures are fine.
- in test_compat.py, just delete the affected tests - we don't need tests for the stdlib function.
- in general I'd encourage you to open a PR with your current state and ask any questions there - the review interface is really helpful for tracking work-in-progress, not just finished or polished contributions!

and thanks for helping out!

issue.title: TST: adapt CI and test suite to breaking changes in pytest 8.4.0
issue.body:
## PR Summary

[example logs](https://github.com/yt-project/yt/actions/runs/15398509744)
This should fix CI, currently broken by the release of pytest 8.4.0: yield-based tests now fail (they previously raised warnings, which apparently we were ignoring)

xref https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/12960

I also updated bleeding-edge CI so next time something like this happens, we get a chance to fix it before the final release.

issue.title: compatibility with Pytest 8.4+

repository.name: python-markdown2
repository.description: markdown2: A fast and complete implementation of Markdown in Python

issue.body:
Hi,

This is tha patch applied in Debian for Pytest 8.4+ compatibility.

https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/changelog.html#pytest-8-4-0-2025-06-02

[#12960](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/12960): Test functions containing a yield now cause an explicit error. They have not been run since pytest 4.0, and were previously marked as an expected failure and deprecation warning.
